original: nāḍīprakāro'pi na yatra kiñcit namīśamātmānamupe hi śāśvatam /
analyzed: nāḍī prakāraḥ upi na yatra kiñcid hi śāśvatam
translated: Where there is no kind of channel, and one goes to the eternal Self, the Lord,

original: na saṃyamī vā yadi vā na saṃyamī niṣkarmako vā yadi vā sa karmakaḥ //
analyzed: na saṃyamī vā yadi vā na saṃyamī niṣkarmakaḥ vā yadi vā sa karmakaḥ
translated: Whether one is self-controlled or not self-controlled, or free from action or engaged in action,

original: ātmaprabodhāt sa vimucyate dhruvaṃ tamīśamātmānamupaiti śāśvatam /
analyzed: ātma prabodhāt sa vimucyate dhruvam tam īśam ātmānam upaiti śāśvatam
translated: He is certainly liberated by the awakening of the Self, and goes to the eternal Self, the Lord.

original: mano na buddhirna śarīramindriyaṃ tanmātra bhūtādi na bhūtapañcakam /🔽p /
analyzed: manaḥ na buddhiḥ na śarīram indriyam tanmātra bhūta ādi na bhūta pañcakam  p
translated: The mind, intellect, body, senses, subtle elements, and the group of five gross elements,

original: ahaṃ kṛtiścāpi na yet svarūpakaṃ tameka mātmānamupaiti śāśvatam //
analyzed: aham kṛtiḥ ca api na yet svarūpakam tam eka mātmānam upaiti śāśvatam
translated: And even the sense of I and action - he goes to that eternal Self, which is not of that nature.

original: tīrthe vāpyatha gehe vā yatra kutra mṛto'pi vā /
analyzed: tīrthe vā api atha gehe vā yatra kutra mṛtaḥ api vā
translated: Whether in a holy place or in a house, or wherever one dies,

original: yogī na paśyate garbhaṃ parabrahmaṇi līyate //🔽tīrthe vā śvapaca gṛhe naṣṭasmṛti parityajan deham /
analyzed: yogī na paśyate garbham para brahmaṇi līyate  tīrthe vā śvapaca gṛhe naṣṭasmṛti parityajan deham
translated: The yogi does not see the womb, but merges into the supreme Brahman.🔽Whether in a holy place or a chandala's house, abandoning the body with lost memory,

analyzed: jñāna sama kāla muktaḥ kaivalyam yāti hata śokaḥ
translated: Liberated simultaneously with knowledge, he attains solitude, his sorrow destroyed.

original: kulīpavitraṃ jananī kṛtārthā viśvaṃbharā puṣyavatī ca pṛthvī /
analyzed: kulīpavitram jananī kṛtārthā viśvaṃbharā puṣyavatī ca pṛthvī
translated: The earth is purified by the dust of his feet, the mother is fulfilled, and the earth is prosperous.

analyzed: apāra saccid sukha sāgare smin līnam pare brahmaṇi yasya cetaḥ
translated: Whose mind is absorbed in the supreme Brahman, in this ocean of infinite pure bliss.

analyzed: yoga śāstrasya sarveṣām śraddhā bhakti purassaram
translated: With faith and devotion, one should always listen to all the Yoga scriptures.

original: śatakṛcchra phalaṃ nityaṃ bhavati śravaṇena tu //
analyzed: śatakṛcchra phalam nityam bhavati śravaṇena tu
translated: By listening, one always obtains the fruit of a hundred austerities.

original: dine dine yogaśāstraṃ yaḥ paṭhed bhakti saṃyutaḥ /
analyzed: dine dine yoga śāstram yaḥ paṭhet bhakti saṃyutaḥ
translated: One who recites the Yoga scriptures daily with devotion,

original: tatra śrīḥ vipulā sadyaḥ ante muktirna saṃśayaḥ //
analyzed: tatra śrīḥ vipulā sadyas ante muktiḥ na saṃśayaḥ
translated: there, great prosperity immediately, and liberation at the end, there is no doubt.

analyzed: iti śrīmat yogasārasaṃgrahe ātmasvarūpanirūpaṇam nāma ṣoḍaśaḥ adhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the sixteenth chapter named The Description of the Nature of the Self in the Compendium of the Essence of Yoga.

analyzed: yama ādi ṣoḍaśa paraiḥ kṛtyaiḥ ātma sthiti kramaḥ
translated: The sequence of the state of the self is done with the sixteen duties beginning with the restraints.

analyzed: saṃproktaḥ ṣoḍaśa adhyāyaiḥ bahu sammatibhiḥ dṛḍham
translated: It is firmly stated in the sixteen chapters with much agreement.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus ends
The Compendium of the Essence of Yoga is complete.
